required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Impact of Implementing Modified Early Warning Score in Terms of Competency and Self-efficacy of Nurses at ILBS, Delhi
clinical_study.official_title: A Quasi Experimental Study to Assess the Impact of Implementing Modified Early Warning Score in Terms of Competency and Self-efficacy of Nurses at ILBS, Delhi

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences, India

clinical_study.source: Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences, India

brief_summary.textblock: In this study nurses will be taught regarding Modified Early Warning Score and how to mark the involved physiological parameters in the MEWS chart and then scoring will be given i.e MEWS score and according to the score intervention would be taken by nurses by communicating with other health team members. this scoring will allow nurses to assess early deterioration and early ICU admission and at last nurses will be asked regarding the barriers or facilitators they faced while performing MEWS score.

detailed_description.textblock:
in this study the objective are to 1. assess the impact of MEWS on the competency and self-efficacy of nurses before and after implementing MEWS. 2. to assess barriers and facilitators that are seen in implementing MEWS. 3. to assess the association between impact of MEWS after implementing MEWS with selected socio-demographic variables.
so, sampling technique used will be total enumeration( nurses of general, semi-private and private ward i.e appox 82) after fulfilling inclusion and exclusion criteria, the pre-test would be of selected nurses after that intervention would be given then after 7 days post-test would be conducted and after that collected data will be analyzed using descriptive and inferential statistics.

primary_outcome.measure: to assess the impact of MEWS on competency and self-efficacy of nurses before and after implementing MEWS
primary_outcome.description: pre-test would be taken to assess previous level and post-test to measure the change in competency

arm_group.description: firstly pre-test would conducted for the group then after 7 days post-test would be conducted for the same group intervention which will be given: training on modified early warning score to staff nurses and marking of physiological parameters on MEWS chart

intervention.description: training on modified early warning signs will be given to staff nurses and they will be asked to mark physiological parameters on MEWS chart and identify detrioration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- registered nurses working in general, semi-private and private ward nurses willing to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- registered nurses who will not be present at the time of data collection. pull out staffs.
